Name: Reach Beyond
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: You've learned to move your spiritual energy past yourself to attack spirits where others can't.

Name: Reactive Dismissal
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You abruptly dismiss your eidolon to reduce the damage it takes, though this makes summoning it again more difficult.

Name: Reactive Pursuit
Benefits: You keep pace with a retreating foe.

Name: Reflexive Catch
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: Grab an item thrown at you.

Name: Remember Your Training
Benefits: You were schooled on a wide variety of creatures you might encounter.

Name: Repeating Hand Crossbow Training
Source: Pathfinder #165
Benefits: You become trained in the repeating hand crossbow and gain access to repeating hand crossbows and shootist bandoliers.

Name: Rescuer's Press
Benefits: Any shield you wield gains the shove trait.

Name: Reverse Engineering
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are able to reverse engineer items into formulas more effectively than most.

Name: Rites of Convocation
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your patron grants you the power to summon other creatures to aid you.

Name: Ritual Researcher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Careful research into the art of rituals has made you better at performing them.

Name: Ritualist Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: expert in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: You have begun to master the difficult art of casting rituals.

Name: Rope Runner
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Pirate Dedication; trained in Acrobatics and Athletics
Benefits: You run and climb across ropes and rigging almost as easily as on the ground.

Name: Running Reload
Benefits: You can reload your weapon on the move.

Name: Sabotage
Benefits: You subtly damage others’ equipment.

Name: Sacred Ki
Prerequisites: Ki Strike; you follow a deity
Benefits: The power of your faith suffuses your ki

Name: Safe House
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You establish a safe house—a secure space in which to hide your secrets from the outside world.

Name: Scales of the Dragon
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Scales grow across your body, protecting you against physical and magical threats.

Name: Scalpel's Point
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your stratagems benefit from your precise knowledge of anatomy.

Name: Scout's Charge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You meander around unpredictably, and then ambush your opponents without warning.

Name: Scout's Warning
Benefits: You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger.

Name: Seeker of Truths
Source: Pathfinder #164
Benefits: Your devotion to discovering and hoarding abstruse truths borders on the fanatical, and you can bring this devotion to bear.

Name: Sense Alignment
Source: Pathfinder #157
Benefits: You read the body language of an intelligent creature within 30 feet and pick up on subtle cues to detect its general propensity for good or evil and law or chaos.

Name: Settlement Scholastics
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your studies open up new horizons.

Name: Shadow Spells
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Hidden darkness whispers to you, teaching you secrets of shadow beyond other spellcasters of your tradition.

Name: Shared Attunment
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: When you would gain a benefit from your terrain attunement, you can grant it to one ally within 30 feet instead of yourself.

Name: Sheltering Cave
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You spend 10 minutes communing with spirits of earth and stone, requesting shelter.

Name: Shielded Stride
Benefits: When your shield is up, your enemies’ blows can’t touch you.

Name: Shrink Down
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon can shrink to fit into small spaces.

Name: Silent Spell
Benefits: You’ve learned how to cast many of your spells without speaking the words of power you would normally need to provide.

Name: Skilled Partner
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon gains a 1st-level skill feat and a 2nd-level or lower skill feat.

Name: Snap Out of It! (Marshal)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You give a quick shout, hoping to shake the fog clouding your ally's thoughts.

Name: Snare Specialist
Benefits: You specialize in creating quick traps to obstruct your enemies on the battlefield.

Name: Sneak Attacker
Benefits: You gain the sneak attack class feature.

Name: Social Purview
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have built a reputation for yourself in your social identity.

Name: Soothing Mist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a connection to the healing properties of nature and can produce a magical mist to heal damage and stop burning or bleeding.

Name: Soul Flare
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You strive to change the outcome with sheer zeal.

Name: Spell Runes
Benefits: The magical runes on your body grant you several magical abilities.

Name: Spellstriker
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain the magus's Spellstrike activity.

Name: Spirit Spells
Benefits: Your ability to confront incorporeal menaces develops into full-fledged spellcasting.

Name: Spiritual Explorer
Benefits: You're familiar with the danger that lingering spirits can pose to an unwary adventurer.

Name: Spiritual Guides
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Though no one sees them and only you can hear them, the spirits around you constantly chatter, save when you are raging.

Name: Split Shot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You fragment a ranged spell into a pair of smaller shots.

Name: Spot Translate
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You interpret a creature's words, repeating their message in a different language that you know.

Name: Stage Fighting
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You pull punches to give a better show.

Name: Stand Still
Benefits: You strike out when your foe tries to flee.

Name: Starlit Eyes
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: Arcane Cascade, starlit span hybrid study
Benefits: Starlight shines in your sight, enhancing your perception and range.

Name: Steady Spellcasting (Magus)
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Confident in your technique, you don't easily lose your concentration when you Cast a Spell.

Name: Steel Skin
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You wear your armor like a second skin.

Name: Steel Yourself!
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You encourage an ally to toughen up, giving them a fighting chance.

Name: Strange Script
Source: Pathfinder #164
Benefits: You have such familiarity with obscure texts that you can compel them to reveal their secrets.

Name: Strategic Assessment
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You learn your foes' strengths and weaknesses by watching them move.

Name: Striker's Scroll
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You can attach a scroll to your weapon or handwraps of mighty blows to blend its spell into an attack, carefully folding it around a part of the weapon or sealing it to the weapon's surface.

Name: Student of the Staff
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: Arcane Cascade, twisting tree hybrid study
Benefits: You've studied the staff extensively to learn the hidden capabilities of your chosen weapon.

Name: Sun Blade
Benefits: You can unleash burning sunlight from your sword or spear.

Name: Supernatural Senses
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Acute Scent or precise or imprecise scent
Benefits: Your scent is preternaturally sharp, and you can always rely on your sense of smell to help guide you when your vision is compromised.

Name: Sure Foot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Horizon Walker Dedication; expert in Acrobatics and Athletics
Benefits: You know the secrets of moving in your favored terrain.

Name: Surprise Attack
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You act before foes can react.

Name: Surprise Snare
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You install one of your snares prepared for quick deployment in a space that's occupied by an opponent.

Name: Swaggering Initiative
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You swagger readily into any fight—even an ambush.

Name: Swipe
Benefits: You make a wide, arcing swing.

Name: Syu Tak-Nwa's Skillful Tresses
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: You can expertly control your living hair and use it to perform various tasks.

Name: Tandem Movement
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You and your eidolon move together.

Name: Tenacious Toxins
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your victims tend to expire long before your poisons, since the latter have been specifically formulated to last longer.

Name: Terrain Scout
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain the Terrain Stalker skill feat twice, choosing a different terrain each time.

Name: The Harder They Fall
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You make your foes fall painfully when you trip them.

Name: Thorough Reports
Benefits: Recalling Knowledge adds creatures to your list, granting you bonuses to Recall in future encounters.

Name: Thousand Faces
Benefits: Your form is as mutable as the weather, changing to meet your whim.

Name: Tools of the Trade
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're well-versed in weapons that allow you to bring bounties in alive.

Name: Treat Condition
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You treat an adjacent creature in an attempt to reduce the clumsy, enfeebled, or sickened condition.

Name: Triple Time
Benefits: You learn to speed up yourself and your allies with your performance.

Name: Twin Distraction
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your movements with two weapons are so swift and disorienting that they befuddle your opponent.

Name: Twin Parry
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use your two weapons to parry attacks.

Name: Versatile Signature
Benefits: You’re always tweaking your available repertoire.

Name: Vibration Sense
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon gains tremorsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.

Name: Viking Weapon Familiarity
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: From childhood, you have been exposed to traditional viking weapons, and you soon learned to handle them in battle.

Name: Vision of Weakness
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can call upon divine insights to single out your foes' weak points.

Name: Warding Light
Benefits: You gain a tattoo that serves as a special ward to defend you against Walkena's forces.

Name: Watch and Learn
Benefits: Pathfinder agents serve as members of diverse teams with complementary skill sets.

Name: Wayfinder Resonance Tinkerer
Benefits: Access a new cantrip by using your Wayfinder.

Name: Wellspring Control
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: When you generate a wellspring surge, roll twice on the Wellspring Surges Table and take the result of your choice.

Name: Wholeness of Body
Benefits: You can restore your health by tapping into your ki.

Name: Woodland Stride
Benefits: You can always find a path, almost as if foliage parted before you.

Name: Wounded Rage
Benefits: You roar in pain, awakening the rage within you.

Name: Adaptive Adept
Benefits: You’ve continued adapting your magic to blend your class’s tradition with your adapted tradition.

Name: Advanced Targeting System
Benefits: Your ocular processors are augmented with advanced targeting systems, which allow you to more easily pinpoint your enemy and read their movements.

Name: Ageless Patience
Benefits: You work at a pace born from longevity that enhances your thoroughness.

Name: Agonizing Rebuke
Benefits: When you terrorize your enemies, you also cause them painful mental distress.

Name: Ally's Shelter
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: In stressful circumstances, you find strength in your allies' example.

Name: Ambush Awareness
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks attempted as initiative rolls.

Name: Amorphous Aspect
Benefits: Your body is supremely flexible.

Name: Ancestral Suspicion
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Long-lived elves have seen civilizations rise and fall, often at the hands of outside forces.

Name: Anchoring Roots
Benefits: Small roots sprout from your feet, steadying you as you move.

Name: Animal Elocutionist
Benefits: You hear animal sounds as conversations instead of unintelligent noise, and can respond in turn.

Name: Animal Speaker
Prerequisites: ability to communicate with some type of animals (such as bats or arthropods)
Benefits: You can speak to all animals, not just a particular subset.

Name: Animalistic Resistance
Benefits: Your animalistic connections help you resist natural afflictions.

Name: Ankle Bite
Prerequisites: Fang Sharpener or Razortooth Goblin heritage
Benefits: Whenever someone grabs onto you, you instinctively bite down hard.

Name: Aquatic Conversationalist
Benefits: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals with the amphibious or aquatic traits.

Name: Athletic Might
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Surviving in hostile terrain has given you a great talent for mobility.

Name: Azarketi Weapon Aptitude
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: You become familiar with using your weapons both in and out of water.

Name: Blessed Blood (Aasimar)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your freshly spilled blood is sanctified, and ingesting it causes effects similar to those of holy water.

Name: Bloody Blows
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your lethal unarmed attacks leave bloody gouges or cause severe internal bleeding.

Name: Boulder Roll
Benefits: Your dwarven build allows you to push foes around, just like a mighty boulder.

Name: Bristle
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You curl into a posture that splays out your bone spines.

Name: Called
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have heard the Call, and in constantly resisting that persistent demand, you've developed a mental bulwark against effects that would target your mind.

Name: Catchy Tune
Benefits: You create a tune so catchy, your foes can't help but dance along.

Name: Catfolk Weapon Rake
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You know how to efficiently use weapons that rake across your enemies.

Name: Celestial Resistance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your growing connection to your celestial forebears has granted you one of their resistances as well.

Name: Ceremony of Knowledge
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You tap into aeon knowledge.

Name: Ceremony of Sunlight
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You have learned how to master the power contained within sunlight, just like the trees that form your body.

Name: Chosen of Lamashtu
Benefits: You bear the favor and blessings of Lamashtu, the Mother of Monsters.

Name: Clan Protector
Benefits: Your clan dagger can protect your allies as easily as yourself.

Name: Clever Improviser
Benefits: You’ve learned how to handle situations when you’re out of your depth.

Name: Clever Shadow
Benefits: You can perform simple Interact actions with your shadow, such as opening an unlocked door.

Name: Climbing Claws
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can extend your claws to aid you in climbing.

Name: Cloud Gazer
Benefits: Your connection to air allows you to see through obscuring mists.

Name: Conrasu Weapon Understanding
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You have come to know conrasu weapons as you know yourself.

Name: Cornered Fury
Benefits: When physically outmatched, you fight with unexpected ferocity.

Name: Crystalline Dust
Benefits: You've learned to disperse the crystalline motes coating your body as a haze.

Name: Cultural Adaptability
Benefits: During your adventures, you’ve honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.

Name: Cunning Hair
Benefits: Your hair moves under your control.

Name: Darkseer
Benefits: Zon-Kuthon smiles upon you—even if you curse his name—granting you pitch-black eyes that allow you to see in shadows and darkness.

Name: Defiance Unto Death
Benefits: You loathe the alghollthus and their mind magic, and you’ve been trained to be willing to die rather than give into mental manipulation.

Name: Defy Death
Benefits: You're exceptionally difficult to kill.

Name: Defy the Darkness
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Using ancient dwarven methods developed to fight enemies wielding magical darkness, you've honed your darkvision and sworn not to use such magic yourself.

Name: Demonblood Frenzy
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Just the taste of fiendish blood is enough to send blood rushing through your veins in a supernatural fury.

Name: Devil in Plain Sight
Benefits: You've learned to draw your fiendish nature into a small ball of corruption and hide it in your soul.

Name: Devilish Wiles
Benefits: Traditionally, fiends are exceptionally good at persuading people to do things, even when their targets know it's a bad idea.

Name: Distant Cackle
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: It takes a very brave person to enter the laughter-haunted forest where you dwell.

Name: Dogfang Bite
Benefits: You can swing your beak to slash your foes when piercing attacks won't do.

Name: Drag Down
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: While swimming in water at least 10 feet deep, you grab an adjacent creature (on nearby land or in the water) and pull it below the surface.

Name: Dwarven Reinforcement
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can use your knowledge of engineering and metalwork to temporarily strengthen thick objects and structures.

Name: Dwarven Weapon Cunning
Benefits: You’ve learned cunning techniques to get the best effects out of your dwarven weapons.

Name: Easily Dismissed
Benefits: You are practiced at blending into the background of the streets and halls of larger folk to ensure that you are overlooked.

Name: Eat Fortune
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: As someone tries to twist fate, you consume the interference.

Name: Eclectic Obsession
Benefits: Your desire for stimulation has led you from one pursuit to another and granted you a smattering of expertise with myriad crafts and professions.

Name: Elemental Bulwark
Benefits: You call upon the corresponding elements of your suli heritage to resist the effect.

Name: Elven Instincts
Benefits: Your senses let you react rapidly.

Name: Elven Weapon Elegance
Benefits: You are attuned to the weapons of your elven ancestors and are particularly deadly when using them.

Name: Empyreal Blessing
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can call forth a benediction upon your allies, whether you pray to a deity of the celestial realms or just find the power within yourself.

Name: Energized Font
Prerequisites: focus pool, at least one innate spell from a gnome heritage or ancestry feat that shares a tradition with at least one of your focus spells
Benefits: The magic within you provides increased energy you can use to focus.

Name: Enthralling Allure
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The powers of domination employed by your progenitors have manifested in you as well.

Name: Envenom Fangs
Benefits: You envenom your fangs.

Name: Expanded Luck
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are luckier even than most catfolk.

Name: Expert Drill Sergeant
Benefits: You know how to get the most out of your allies.

Name: Extinguish Light
Benefits: You wrap shadow around a single unattended light source within 120 feet that's no larger than a torch.

Name: Favorable Winds
Benefits: You wrap a shell of favorable wind around a weapon you wield.

Name: Feathered Cloak
Benefits: To blend in with the grounded and wingless, you fold your wings just so on your back, creating the illusion of a feathered cloak.

Name: Feed on Pain
Benefits: The psychic feedback of another creature's pain fills you with false life.

Name: Fey Disguise
Benefits: You can disguise yourself with magical illusions.

Name: Fey Influence
Source: PFS Scenario #1-17
Benefits: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic

Name: Fiendish Resistance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your connection to your fiendish forebears has granted you one of their resistances as well.

Name: Finned Ridges
Benefits: The ridges and flaps of your skin steer you through the water.

Name: Firesight
Benefits: You can see through the haze of flame.

Name: Fledgling Flight
Benefits: You can fly through the air in short bursts at half your land Speed.

Name: Flexible Tail
Benefits: You can perform simple Interact actions with your tail, such as opening an unlocked door.

Name: Fluid Contortionist
Benefits: You can ignore difficult terrain caused by moving through tight spaces that aren't tight enough to force you to Squeeze.

Name: Focused Cat Nap
Benefits: When you Cat Nap, you can also Refocus as you dream of a relevant activity.

Name: Forest Stealth
Benefits: You are skilled at quickly hiding behind bits of underbrush or foliage.

Name: Formation Training
Benefits: You know how to fight in formation with your brethren.

Name: Fortify Shield
Benefits: You reinforce your shield with a rocky outgrowth of metal and stone.

Name: Friendform
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: The shared bond between you and your allies allows you to act on their behalf.

Name: Gaping Flesh
Benefits: Your wound yawns open, appalling your attacker.

Name: Garuda's Squall
Benefits: Garudas' marksmanship and magic are second nature to you.

Name: Gecko's Grip
Benefits: You stick to walls with a preternatural grip.

Name: Genie Weapon Flourish
Benefits: Whenever you critically hit using a falchion, ranseur, scimitar, trident, or a geniekin weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.

Name: Gnaw
Benefits: With enough time and determination, you can chew through nearly anything.

Name: Gnoll Weapon Practicality
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You have come to know gnoll weapons as you know yourself.

Name: Gnome Weapon Innovator
Benefits: You produce outstanding results when wielding unusual weapons.

Name: Goblin Weapon Frenzy
Benefits: You know how to wield your people’s vicious weapons.

Name: Graceful Guidance
Benefits: You can demonstrate how to quickly twist out of the way of dangerous effects.

Name: Greater Animal Senses
Benefits: Your senses advance to match those of your animal aspect.

Name: Grippli Glide
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You can use your webbed feet to guide your fall.

Name: Grippli Weapon Innovator
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You've learned devious ways to make the most of your grippli weapons.

Name: Grovel
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With obsequious words and begging gestures, you convince your foe you're less of a threat.

Name: Guided by the Stars
Benefits: The stars grant you insights that guide your actions.

Name: Halfling Ingenuity
Benefits: While your willingness to dig into a task you know little about might get you into trouble, your incredible luck often saves you from danger.

Name: Halfling Weapon Trickster
Benefits: You are particularly adept at fighting with your people’s favored weapons.

Name: Healer's Halo
Benefits: Your halo can enhance positive energy.

Name: Heatwave
Benefits: You harness the oncoming flames and twist them into a screen of heat and smoke, granting you concealment until the beginning of your next turn.

Name: Hobgoblin Weapon Discipline
Benefits: You know how to efficiently utilize the weapons soldiers use in close quarters.

Name: Hold Mark
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You bear scars or tattoos enhanced by the mark of your community's prowess.

Name: Hopping Stride
Benefits: You've internalized the hopping gait of your vampiric forebear.

Name: Hunter's Fangs
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your fangs are exceptionally painful.

Name: Hybrid Form
Benefits: When you Change Shape, you retain elements of your kitsune form, allowing you to speak in a fox form, use kitsune unarmed attacks in a tailless form, or gain a tail in your tailless form to use abilities that require one.

Name: Hybrid Shape
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Mastery of your shapeshifting lets you combine the best features of your humanoid and spider forms.

Name: Inoculation Subroutine
Benefits: Your nanites reject diseases with ease.

Name: Inspire Imitation
Benefits: Your own actions inspire your allies to great achievements.

Name: Intercorporate
Benefits: Your ordered physiology rejects unwelcome elements.

Name: Intuitive Illusions
Benefits: Illusion magic comes to you so naturally that you can effortlessly sustain your magical ruses.

Name: Inured to the Heat
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your have a love for extreme heat.

Name: Iruxi Glide
Benefits: You glide slowly toward the ground, 5 feet down and up to 25 feet forward through the air.

Name: Iruxi Unarmed Cunning
Benefits: You make the most of your iruxi unarmed attacks.

Name: Kitsune Spell Mysteries
Prerequisites: at least one innate spell from a kitsune heritage or ancestry feat
Benefits: You know more kitsune magic.

Name: Kneecap
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You deliver a punishing blow to an enemy's knee, shin, or other vulnerable anatomy within your reach.

Name: Kobold Weapon Innovator
Benefits: You've learned devious tactics with your kobold weapons.

Name: Lab Rat
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've spent more than your share of time in an alchemy lab.

Name: Leshy Glide
Prerequisites: Leaf Leshy heritage or Cat Fall
Benefits: Using your own leaves, you can control your descent.

Name: Lifesense
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a limited ability to sense life force, like your psychopomp forebears.

Name: Light Paws
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can balance on your toes to step carefully over obstructions.

Name: Lightless Litheness
Benefits: Your body is almost as flexible as your shadow.

Name: Long Tongue
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You've learned to stretch your exceptionally long tongue beyond its original limits.

Name: Long-Nosed Form
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can transform into a specific, curious-looking human form.

Name: Loud Singer
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Staying on pitch, proper breath control, and remembering the words are all less important than the real measure of a good singer: volume! The range of your Goblin Song is increased to 60 feet, and you can target one additional enemy when you use it.

Name: Loyal Empath
Benefits: You have incredible empathy for your friends and family, and you have an innate timing for helping others in distress.

Name: Lucky Break
Benefits: You catch yourself as you make a mistake.

Name: Magpie Snatch
Benefits: You move quickly, snatching a shiny item that catches your eye.

Name: Malicious Bane
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Whether your heart is pure or corrupt, you can call forth a malediction upon your foes.

Name: Marine Ally
Benefits: You've befriended a sea creature, which becomes magically bonded to you.

Name: Martial Experience
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've crossed blades with a wide variety of foes wielding a wide variety of weapons, and you've learned the basics of fighting with nearly any of them.

Name: Mask of Power
Benefits: Your warmask sharpens your connection to the source of your mask's power.

Name: Mask of Rejection
Benefits: Your warmask projects a white-hot fury that attempts to vaporize the offending magic.

Name: Mist Child
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You blend in with unnatural subtlety.

Name: Mutate Weapon
Benefits: deal more damage with your Living Weapon.

Name: Myriad Forms
Benefits: With a bit of self-discovery, you find a new form.

Name: Nanite Shroud
Benefits: Your nanites fly out of your body, swarming around you in a cloud.

Name: Natural Illusionist
Benefits: By drawing upon the First World’s magic, you can siphon a portion of that malleable world to create a convincing illusion.

Name: Necromantic Physiology
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your unusual physiology has developed in a way that makes it difficult for parasites and other infestations to prey upon you.

Name: Offensive Analysis
Benefits: You can enhance your senses and mental state to consider every aspect of an attack.

Name: One-Toed Hop
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Assuming a peculiar stance, you make a short hop on each toe.

Name: Orc Weapon Carnage
Benefits: You are brutally efficient with the weapons of your orc ancestors.

Name: Ornate Tattoo
Benefits: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic.

Name: Pack Stalker
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Ambushes are an honored gnoll tradition.

Name: Plague Sniffer
Benefits: You can sniff out the pungent tang of disease.

Name: Powerful Guts
Benefits: Your stomach is particularly durable.

Name: Practiced Paddler
Benefits: You’re skilled at navigating bogs and marshes, even for a paddler shoony.

Name: Pride Hunter
Benefits: You avoid the attention of creatures focused on your allies.

Name: Project Persona
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Where others etch their armor to serve as a conduit for their imaginations, your vivid mind and bold personality allow you to project a more fitting persona over your lackluster armor.

Name: Protective Claws
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: The chitin on your claws is so hard you can defend against attacks with them.

Name: Protective Sheath
Benefits: When you lash out with your clan dagger, you keep its sheath close at hand.

Name: Protective Subroutine
Benefits: Your nanites can augment your defenses.

Name: Quick Stow (Ratfolk)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are adept at quickly moving items into your cheek pouches.

Name: Rat Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: There always seems to be a little rat around to carry messages for you.

Name: Ratfolk Roll
Benefits: Your ability to curl up into a tight ball comes in handy.

Name: Recognize Ambush
Benefits: Your combat training has honed you to be ready for an attack at all times.

Name: Renewing Quills
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your spines grow back much faster than other shisks.

Name: Right-Hand Blood
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: It's said that the flesh of the right side of a hyena can heal diseases, but that of the left side is poisonous.

Name: Ritual Reversion
Benefits: You can temporarily revert to a less conspicuous form without diminishing your senses.

Name: Runtsage
Benefits: Unlike most of your kind, who dismiss goblins as embarrassments or expendable annoyances, you have studied the methodology behind their irresponsible and incomprehensible actions.

Name: Scar-Thick Skin
Benefits: Glorious, storied scars cover and protect much of your body.

Name: Sense Allies
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Like many humans raised in a close-knit community, you have always been strongly attuned to the presence of others.

Name: Shadowy Disguise
Benefits: You wrap yourself in shadow to change your appearance.

Name: Shared Luck (Halfling)
Benefits: You are evidence that it’s lucky to travel with a halfling.

Name: Shed Tail
Benefits: You can shed your tail to escape.

Name: Sheltering Slab
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The stone around you is your ally, and you have learned to use it to shore up your weaknesses.

Name: Shifting Faces
Benefits: You wear many faces, even those that don't belong to you.

Name: Shoki's Argument
Benefits: You feel a connection to shokis, the rambling collectors of wayward souls, and might have found old texts written by one.

Name: Skillful Tail
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've always had a tail, but with practice, you've learned to use it for more than signaling your mood.

Name: Skillful Tail (Ganzi)
Benefits: You have a tail or similar body part that is always willing to lend a hand (so to speak).

Name: Skillful Tail (Geniekin)
Benefits: You were born with a tail, and with practice you've learned how to perform simple Interact actions with it, such as opening an unlocked door.

Name: Slip with the Breeze
Benefits: You create gusts of wind when you jump, allowing you to carry yourself across greater distances.

Name: Snare Genius
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your expertise makes your snares more powerful, and you can place them quickly and efficiently.

Name: Speak with Kindred
Benefits: You have a connection with creatures that share your physiology.

Name: Spirit Soother
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are attuned to the minute sounds and sensations of restless spirits.

Name: Springing Leaper
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your powerful legs allow you to make sudden and dramatic leaps.

Name: Steam Spell
Benefits: You transform your fire spells into steam, making them more effective underwater.

Name: Step Lively
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are an expert at avoiding the lumbering footsteps of larger creatures.

Name: Strix Vengeance
Benefits: You dedicate yourself to destroying those who harm your kin.

Name: Supernatural Charm
Benefits: The elven magic in your blood manifests as a force you can use to become more appealing or alluring.

Name: Swift Swimmer
Benefits: You swim faster than most iruxi.

Name: Tail Spin
Benefits: You excel at using your tail as a weapon to upend your foes.

Name: Taste Blood
Prerequisites: Cel Rau, Straveika, Svetocher, or another lineage from a vampire with the Drink Blood ability
Benefits: You retain not only your vampiric parent's taste for blood but their ability to gain vitality from it.

Name: Tenacious Net
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Escaping your nets is no simple task.

Name: Tengu Feather Fan
Benefits: You've learned to bind some of your feathers together into a fan to focus your ancestral magic.

Name: Tengu Weapon Study
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned techniques for using blades and other tengu weapons.

Name: Thrown Voice
Benefits: You've learned how to throw your voice through the winds, tricking others as to your location.

Name: Tomb-Watcher's Glare
Benefits: When you critically hit an undead creature, or an undead creature critically fails a saving throw against one of your abilities, you drive your divine wrath home in your enemy’s heart.

Name: Tongue Disarm
Benefits: You lash out with your tongue to disarm your foe.

Name: Torch Goblin
Benefits: You’ve spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage.

Name: Tough Tumbler
Benefits: You’ve taken your share of licks while scurrying around the battlefield and know how to defend yourself against opportunistic attackers.

Name: Tranquil Sanctuary
Benefits: Whenever possible, you follow the serene path and encourage others to do the same.

Name: Treacherous Earth
Benefits: You have the power to shatter the earth into a shape of your devising.

Name: Tree Climber (Goblin)
Prerequisites: Tailed Goblin heritage or Treedweller Goblin heritage
Benefits: Your time in forest or jungle canopies has taught you how to scramble across branches with sure feet.

Name: Uncanny Awareness
Benefits: You have a keen sense of movement around you.

Name: Undead Companion
Prerequisites: an animal companion or a familiar
Benefits: Your companion is also touched by undeath, a mix of a traditional companion and a skeleton, zombie, or stranger form of unlife.

Name: Undead Slayer
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your knowledge of your own not-quite-living anatomy, combined with your experience in combat, helps you take down undead foes with ease.

Name: Vandal
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a knack for breaking and dismantling things.

Name: Vanth's Weapon Execution
Benefits: You've trained in the finer points of dealing death.

Name: Victorious Vigor
Benefits: Your victories in battle fill you with pride and imbue you with the energy to fight a bit longer despite your wounds.

Name: Ward Against Corruption
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your soul is warded against the power of undeath and plague, as well as that of the evil former psychopomps known as sahkils.

Name: Water Conjuration
Benefits: You carry the ocean with you wherever you go.

Name: Wavetouched Paragon
Benefits: You have been blessed by the sea, granting you the ability to swim like a fish.

Name: Wildborn Adept
Benefits: The whispers of the jungle grant you more diverse access to simple primal magic.

Name: Winglets
Benefits: You're among the few kobolds who grow a set of draconic wings later in life.

Name: Abundant Step
Benefits: You can teleport yourself a short distance.

Name: Adaptive Mask Familiar
Benefits: Your mask familiar adapts quickly to material form, allowing it to gain more familiar and master abilities.

Name: Additional Recollection
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You scan the battlefield quickly, remembering critical details about multiple opponents you face.

Name: Advanced Arcana
Benefits: You gain one wizard feat.

Name: Advanced Blood Potency
Benefits: You gain one sorcerer feat.

Name: Advanced Bloodline
Benefits: You have studied your bloodline to learn the secrets of its magic.

Name: Advanced Bow Training
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Through constant practice and the crucible of experience, you increase your skill with advanced bows.

Name: Advanced Concoction
Benefits: You gain one alchemist feat.

Name: Advanced Deduction
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain one investigator feat.

Name: Advanced Devotion
Benefits: You gain one champion feat.

Name: Advanced Dogma
Benefits: You gain one cleric feat.

Name: Advanced Elemental Spell
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: flame order, stone order, storm order, or wave order
Benefits: Your connection to one of the great elemental aspects of nature deepens, allowing you further control over its powers.

Name: Advanced Flair
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain one swashbuckler feat.

Name: Advanced Fury
Benefits: You gain one barbarian feat.

Name: Advanced Hunter's Trick
Benefits: You gain one ranger feat.

Name: Advanced Kata
Benefits: You gain one monk feat.

Name: Advanced Maneuver
Benefits: You gain a fighter feat.

Name: Advanced Martial Magic
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain one magus feat.

Name: Advanced Muse's Whispers
Benefits: You gain one bard feat.

Name: Advanced Mysteries
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain one oracle feat.

Name: Advanced Red Mantis Magic
Benefits: Your Red Mantis magical training has improved.

Name: Advanced Revelation
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You learn an advanced revelation spell associated with your mystery.

Name: Advanced Synergy
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain one summoner feat.

Name: Advanced Trickery
Benefits: You gain one rogue feat.

Name: Advanced Weapon Training
Benefits: You’ve studied the art of wielding an advanced weapon.

Name: Advanced Wilding
Benefits: You gain one druid feat.

Name: Advanced Witchcraft
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You gain one witch feat.

Name: Advantageous Assault
Benefits: When an enemy’s movement is compromised, you deliver a more deadly blow.

Name: Agile Maneuvers
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your easily maneuver against your foes.

Name: Aldori Riposte
Benefits: Learn to strike back at your opponent when they fail to attack you.

Name: Align Ki
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The power of your ki soothes your wounds and energizes you for battle.

Name: Analyze Idiolect
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Linguist Dedication; expert in Deception and Society
Benefits: You break down a specific individual's idiolect, memorizing their speech mannerisms and habits.

Name: Analyze Weakness
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your knowledge of a creature's physiology and understanding of tactics helps you attack with pinpoint accuracy.

Name: Animal Skin
Benefits: When you are raging and unarmored, your skin transforms into a thick hide.

Name: Anticipate Ambush
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Using your extensive knowledge of ambush tactics, you keep watch for any hidden creatures or dangerous sites, moving at half your travel speed.

Name: Arcane Sensitivity
Source: Pathfinder #157
Benefits: You can sense the presence of the supernatural, even if you don't have any magical ability yourself.

Name: Archaeologist's Warning
Benefits: You visually or audibly warn your companions of danger, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls.

Name: Armor Specialist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have trained hard to optimize your armor's protective qualities.

Name: Artokus's Fire
Benefits: Artokus developed a mixture of volatile materials that burns hotter and longer than typical alchemist's fire.

Name: Assured Knowledge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can procure information with confidence.

Name: Attack of Opportunity
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You swat a foe that leaves an opening.

Name: Axe Thrower
Benefits: You have mastered the weight and balance of a variety of axes and can lob them with ease.

Name: Basic Magus Spellcasting
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain the basic bounded spellcasting benefits.

Name: Basic Scroll Cache
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a vast and overflowing collection of scroll scraps, riddled with errors and misspellings and leaking energy like a sieve.

Name: Basic Summoner Spellcasting
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You gain the basic bounded spellcasting benefits.

Name: Beastmaster's Trance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can enter a trance that allows you to briefly inhabit the body of one of your animal companions and share its senses.

Name: Bellflower Dedication
Prerequisites: member of the Bellflower Network; expert in Stealth and Survival; Charisma 14
Benefits: You dedicate yourself to freeing slaves and escorting them to freedom.

Name: Blazing Talon Surge
Benefits: You rush forward and latch onto your enemy with talons of hungering fire.

Name: Blood Frenzy
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon flies into a frenzy.

Name: Boaster's Challenge
Prerequisites: Firebrand Braggart Dedication; expert in Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation
Benefits: You call out a foe, causing them to become flustered and easier to defeat.

Name: Bolera's Interrogation
Source: Pathfinder #157
Benefits: You can force a creature to tell the truth

Name: Brutal Bully
Benefits: You push your foes around and leave bruises.

Name: Burning Spell
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You enhance your spell with elemental fire, causing it to set the target on fire.

Name: Butterfly's Kiss
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: You can make nonlethal Strikes with a butterfly sword without taking a penalty.

Name: Butterfly's Sting
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: You gain the sneak attack class feature.

Name: Cadence Call
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You call out a quick cadence, guiding your allies into a more efficient rhythm.

Name: Cascade Bearer's Flexibility
Prerequisites: Magaambyan Attendant Dedication; Cascade Bearers affiliation
Benefits: You call upon your Cascade Bearer training to help you adjust a spell for the current situation.

Name: Cascade Countermeasure
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: When in Arcane Cascade, you can make yourself resistant to magic.

Name: Cast Down
Prerequisites: harmful font or healing font
Benefits: The sheer force of your faith can bring a foe crashing down.

Name: Champion's Reaction
Benefits: You can use the champion’s reaction associated with your cause.

Name: Clear the Way
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You put your body behind your massive weapon and swing, shoving enemies to clear a wide path.

Name: Cleave
Benefits: You swing clear through one foe and into another.

Name: Combination Finisher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You combine a series of attacks with a powerful finishing blow.

Name: Combine Elixirs
Benefits: You’ve discovered how to mix two elixirs into a single hybrid concoction.

Name: Connect the Dots
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Ephemeral connections between people, places, and concepts are invisible to most, but seeing them is your stock and trade.

Name: Convincing Illusion
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use your deceptive skills to make your illusions seem even more real.

Name: Corrupted Shield
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: divine ally (shield); tenets of evil
Benefits: Your shield ally is more than just a spirit of protection— it's a conduit for deadly divine magic.

Name: Counter Perform
Benefits: You gain the counter performance composition spell.

Name: Craft Facsimile
Prerequisites: Pathfinder Agent Dedication; expert in Crafting
Benefits: You're renowned for your ability to recover important items and sometimes that requires creating a stand-in.

Name: Crane Flutter
Benefits: You interpose your arm between yourself and your opponent.

Name: Crimson Shroud
Benefits: You can surround yourself with bloody mist.

Name: Crossbow Terror
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are a dynamo with the crossbow.

Name: Crowd Mastery
Benefits: You use the crowd to your advantage, diverting your foes’ attention to potential hidden dangers in the crowd.

Name: Current Spell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: As you use your magic to manipulate air or water, you divert some of its currents to form a barrier around you.

Name: Daring Act
Prerequisites: Firebrand Braggart Dedication; trained in Acrobatics or Athletics
Benefits: You attempt a death-defying maneuver to distract your enemies.

Name: Dazing Blow
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You pummel a held foe, hoping to stagger them.

Name: Debilitating Bomb
Benefits: Your bombs impose additional effects on your enemies.

Name: Defend Mount
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You interpose yourself between an attacker and your mount, defending your mount from harm.

Name: Defensive Coordination
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Like the storied heroes who persist in the face of overwhelming odds, you and your allies will hold the line.

Name: Directional Bombs
Benefits: You can lob bombs with great force and a precise trajectory to angle the splash in a cone spraying in a single direction.

Name: Dirge of Doom
Benefits: You learn to frighten your enemies with your performance.

Name: Disarming Stance
Benefits: You adopt a fencing stance that improves your control over your weapon.

Name: Discerning Strike
Benefits: Identifying a creature is the first step in finding its weaknesses.

Name: Disciple of Shade
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You've delved deeper into the mysteries of shadow and become blessed with magical power that increases your skills in the arts of deception and persuasion.

Name: Disrupting Strikes
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: You call forth positive energy from within to help you destroy undead.

Name: Diverting Vortex
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You transfer vestiges of magical energy to the air around you, creating a vortex that deflects ranged attacks.

Name: Divine Ally
Benefits: You gain a divine ally of your choice.

Name: Divine Weapon
Benefits: You siphon residual spell energy into a weapon you’re wielding.

Name: Dodge Away
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use your acrobatic prowess to evade an attack, using momentum to keep yourself moving, if you choose.

Name: Dragon Roar
Benefits: You bellow, instilling fear in your enemies.

Name: Dragon's Rage Breath
Benefits: You exhale powerful draconic energy.

Name: Educate Allies
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You tweak the properties of your composition spell to convey a bit of your defensive knowledge.

Name: Eidolon's Opportunity
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon makes a melee Strike against the triggering creature.

Name: Eidolon's Wrath
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon gains the eidolon's wrath focus spell, which it casts, instead of you.

Name: Eldritch Archer Dedication
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: expert in at least one type of bow
Benefits: You blend magic with your archery, leading to powerful results.

Name: Emerald Boughs Accustomation
Prerequisites: Magaambyan Attendant Dedication; Emerald Boughs affiliation; expert in Society
Benefits: You are comfortable and socially capable in almost any cultural context.

Name: Endemic Herbs
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: During your daily preparations, you find medicinal plants endemic to your location.

Name: Energetic Resonance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your blood resonates with magical energy, mitigating the effects of harmful spells.

Name: Ephemeral Tracking
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are able to track your quarry through impossible places.

Name: Expeditious Advance
Benefits: You advance and retreat quickly.

Name: Expert Alchemy
Benefits: Your advanced alchemy level increases to 3.

Name: Expert Herbalism
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your advanced alchemy level for herbalism increases to your level – 3.

Name: Expert Poisoner
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your advanced alchemy level for poison increases to your level – 3.

Name: Far Throw
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you Strike with a thrown weapon, you take only a –1 penalty for each additional range increment between you and the target, rather than a –2 penalty.

Name: Fleeting Shadow
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're able to quickly disappear and then move about stealthily.

Name: Flexible Ritualist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can perform two aspects of a ritual yourself.

Name: Follow-Up Strike
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have trained to use all parts of your body as a weapon.

Name: Forced Entry
Prerequisites: Pathfinder Agent Dedication; expert in Athletics
Benefits: You are trained to preserve the archaeological value of your location when entering.

Name: Furious Focus
Benefits: You’ve learned to maintain your balance even when swinging furiously.

Name: Gang Up
Benefits: You and your allies harry an opponent in concert.

Name: Ghost Strike
Benefits: You can infuse a weapon you are carrying with magical energies that allow it to strike true against incorporeal undead.

Name: Giant's Stature
Benefits: You grow to incredible size.

Name: Gorilla Pound
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You pound your chest before slamming into your foes.

Name: Grave Sense
Benefits: Learn how to sense undead in the area.

Name: Greater Lesson
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your patron grants you greater knowledge.

Name: Green Empathy
Benefits: You can communicate with plants on a basic level and use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on them and to make very simple Requests of them.

Name: Guardian's Deflection (Fighter)
Benefits: You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally.

Name: Halcyon Speaker Dedication
Prerequisites: Magaambyan Attendant Dedication; member of the Magaambya of conversant rank
Benefits: You devote much of your study to halcyon magic.

Name: Harmonize
Benefits: You can perform multiple compositions simultaneously.

Name: Heaven's Thunder
Benefits: With a loud shout, you unleash your ki in a crackling shroud of thunder and lightning that engulfs your body.

Name: Hellknight Dedication
Prerequisites: Hellknight Armiger Dedication; lawful alignment; member of a Hellknight Order; passed the Hellknight Test
Benefits: You have forged your body to comply with the commands of your mind—orders steeped in the Measure and the Chain.

Name: Hellknight Signifer Dedication
Prerequisites: spellcasting class feature; Hellknight Armiger Dedication; lawful alignment; member of a Hellknight Order; passed the Hellknight Test
Benefits: You have bolstered your force of will with the power of the Measure and the Chain.

Name: High-Quality Scrounger
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you Craft a temporary item using Scrounger Dedication, it can be an item of up to 3rd level.

Name: Holistic Care
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You provide emotional and spiritual care.

Name: Improved Familiar (Familiar Master)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You find it easy to attract a powerful and unusual familiar to your side.

Name: Inner Fire (SoM)
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: While you're in Stoked Flame Stance, you have cold and fire resistance equal to half your level, and any creature that hits you with an unarmed attack, tries to Grab or Grapple you, or otherwise touches you takes fire damage equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).

Name: Inner Strength
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your strength is part of your rage, so as long as your anger remains, you can gather your strength and rage to overcome any sort of enfeeblement.

Name: Insect Shape
Benefits: Your understanding of life expands, allowing you to mimic a wider range of creatures.

Name: Instinct Ability
Benefits: You gain the instinct ability for the instinct you chose for Barbarian Dedication.

Name: Invigorating Mercy
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your divine touch rejuvenates the weak and tired.

Name: Jellyfish Stance
Benefits: You relax your posture and loosen your joints, allowing yourself to move with incredible fluidity.

Name: Keen Recollection
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can recall all sorts of information.

Name: Keep Pace
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your prey can't Escape.

Name: Ki Blast
Benefits: You can unleash an impactful cone of force by channeling your ki.

Name: Knight Reclaimant Dedication
Prerequisites: any non-evil alignment; member of the Knights of Lastwall of knight rank; trained in Stealth and Survival
Benefits: You have sworn the Crimson Oath and become a full member of the Crimson Reclaimers.

Name: Knight Vigilant
Prerequisites: any good alignment; member of the Knights of Lastwall of knight rank; trained in Religion
Benefits: You are dedicated to the cause of the Shining Sentinels.

Name: Knowledge is Power
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: When you critically succeed at a Recall Knowledge check about a creature, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next attack roll against the creature, to your AC against its next attack roll, and to your save against its next effect requiring a save.

Name: Light Step
Benefits: You aren’t bothered by tricky footing.

Name: Litany Against Wrath
Prerequisites: devotion spells; tenets of good
Benefits: You excoriate a foe for its wrath against goodly creatures.

Name: Living Rune
Benefits: You’ve bridged a connection between the runes on your body and the magic of runestones, allowing you to place an armor rune on your living flesh.

Name: Loyal Warhorse
Benefits: You and your mount have grown closer, and your loyalty to each other is unbreakable.

Name: Mage Hunter
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You use your hatred of magic to lash out at the sight of spellcasting, allowing you to interrupt an enemy's spell.

Name: Magic Hands
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The blessing of your deity heightens your healing ability, making your mundane healing work as if by magic.

Name: Master Summoner
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: During daily preparations, you can designate one of your spell slots to become two summoning slots of the same spell level, from which you can cast only summoning or incarnate spells.

Name: Mastermind's Eye
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: When you identify a creature with Recall Knowledge, that creature is flat-footed to you.

Name: Mature Animal Companion (Ranger)
Benefits: Your animal companion grows up, gaining additional capabilities.

Name: Mature Trained Companion
Source: Pathfinder #152
Benefits: Your animal companion grows up, becoming a mature animal companion.

Name: Mesmerizing Gaze
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you meet someone's gaze, they are unable to look away.

Name: Mountain Stronghold
Benefits: You focus on your connection to the earth and call upon the mountain to block attacks against you.

Name: Mounted Shield
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've trained with your shield to defend both yourself and your mount.

Name: Nameless Anonymity
Benefits: Your mask protects you further from divination.

Name: Narrative Conduit
Source: Pathfinder #170
Benefits: You act as a conduit for your companions just as your stories are a conduit between teller and listener.

Name: Nimble Shield Hand
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are so used to wielding a shield that you can do so even while using the hand that's holding it for other purposes.

Name: Nocturnal Sense
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: Acute Scent or precise or imprecise scent and low-light vision
Benefits: Your senses gain even greater clarity.

Name: One-Inch Punch
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You put all your force into a single mighty, carefully controlled blow.

Name: Ostentatious Arrival
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: If the next action you take is to Manifest your Eidolon as a three-action activity, or to Cast a three-action summoning Spell, the creature appears in an explosion.

Name: Perfect Ki Adept
Benefits: You gain the appropriate ki spell for your School of Perfection.

Name: Performative Weapons Training
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're skilled with flashy weapons.

Name: Perpetual Scout
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You spot anything out of place in the areas you know best.

Name: Phase Out
Source: Secrets of Magic
Prerequisites: your eidolon is a phantom
Benefits: Your eidolon phases out of reality slightly, gaining resistance to all damage (except force and negative) equal to half your level.

Name: Poison Coat
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: In nature, certain animals are covered in venomous spines, such that even touching them is deadly.

Name: Polearm Tricks
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your connection to rune magic has revealed tricks to make polearms deadlier in your hands.

Name: Precise Finisher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Even when your foe avoids your Confident Finisher, you can still hit a vital spot.

Name: Predictive Purchase (Investigator)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have just the thing for the situation.

Name: Quick Snares
Benefits: You can rig a snare in only moments.

Name: Rain-Scribe Sustenance
Benefits: You use the power of your Rain-Scribe magic to draw on a stream of primal power for sustenance.

Name: Rallying Charge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your fearless charge into battle reinvigorates your allies to carry on the fight.

Name: Ranger's Bramble
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can cause plants to grow and trap your foes with thorns.

Name: Rapid Manifestation
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your unwavering soul brings up your defenses as soon as you're in danger.

Name: Reflexive Shield
Benefits: You can use your shield to fend off the worst of area effects and other damage.

Name: Relentless Disarm
Source: Pathfinder #149
Prerequisites: Zephyr Guard Dedication; trained in Athletics
Benefits: You have been trained to disarm foes.

Name: Reloading Trick
Source: Pathfinder #165
Benefits: You can fire off a single shot even when unprepared. You Interact to reload your hand crossbow and Strike with it.

Name: Remote Trigger
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned how to trigger snares from afar.

Name: Resourceful Ritualist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can cast difficult rituals that might otherwise be just beyond your skill.

Name: Return Fire
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Snatching an arrow out of the air, you instantly put it to your bow and return fire.

Name: Revealing Stab
Benefits: You drive your piercing weapon into an imperceptible foe, revealing its location to your allies.

Name: Ricochet Stance (Fighter)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You adopt a stance designed to rebound your thrown weapons back toward you.

Name: Rough Terrain Stance
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You enter a stance that makes it difficult to move around you.

Name: Scholarly Defense
Source: Pathfinder #164
Benefits: Your knowledge of strange creatures and their bizarre anatomy allows you to anticipate their physical attacks and reduce the damage you take from them.

Name: Scouring Rage
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: an instinct that allows you to change your additional damage from Rage to a different damage type
Benefits: You emit a powerful surge of instinctual energy when you unleash your potential.

Name: Scout's Speed
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You move faster, especially when traveling, allowing you to scout ahead and report back without slowing your allies.

Name: Scrollmaster Dedication
Prerequisites: expert in any Lore skill; member of the Pathfinder Society affiliated with the School of Scrolls
Benefits: Your experience chronicling adventures and discoveries grants you heightened discernment and memory.

Name: Second Shield
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're used to your shield breaking in the middle of battle.

Name: Selective Energy
Benefits: As you call down divine power, you can prevent some enemies from benefiting or some allies from being hurt.

Name: Shatter Defenses
Benefits: Your offense exploits your enemy’s fear. Make a melee Strike against a frightened creature.

Name: Shield Warden
Prerequisites: [Champion] divine ally (shield); tenets of good; [Fighter] Shield Block
Benefits: You use your shield to protect your allies as well as yourself.

Name: Shielded Tome
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: During your daily preparations, you can magically fuse a shield into your favorite book, where it appears as an elaborate bookmark.

Name: Shove Down
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You leverage your weight to topple foes that you move.

Name: Simple Crystal Magic
Source: Pathfinder #148
Benefits: You are capable of seeing magic as flowing runes and can scribe a personal rune that represents you.

Name: Skirmish Strike
Benefits: Your feet and weapon move in tandem.

Name: Sky and Heaven Stance
Benefits: You enter a stance allowing you to make jagged strikes like flashes of lightning through the sky.

Name: Slice and Swipe
Benefits: Steal from your target when you successfully strike them.

Name: Smite Evil
Prerequisites: divine ally (blade); tenets of good
Benefits: Your blade ally becomes an even more powerful tool against evildoers.

Name: Smite Good
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: divine ally (blade); tenets of evil
Benefits: Your blade ally shares your lust for the blood of good creatures.

Name: Snap Shot
Benefits: You’ve learned to react with ranged weapons when a creature is in close quarters.

Name: Song of Marching
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You learn the song of marching composition cantrip, which enables you and your allies to cross vast distances without strain.

Name: Soul Arsenal
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Choose an additional soulforged armament of a different type than the type you already chose, and choose one essence power for it.

Name: Spell Penetration
Benefits: You’ve studied ways of overcoming the innate magical resistance that certain powerful creatures have.

Name: Spell Relay
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You open the power in your blood to your ally's spellcasting, using your magic to boost their range.

Name: Spellmaster Dedication
Prerequisites: ability to cast focus spells; member of the Pathfinder Society affiliated with the School of Spells; Intelligence 14, Charisma 14, or Wisdom 14
Benefits: As a Spellmaster, you are adept at identifying magic.

Name: Spirits' Interference
Benefits: You call forth protective spirits to ward off ranged attacks.

Name: Spiritual Sense
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a vague connection to the Ethereal Plane that enables you to notice spirits.

Name: Split Slot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can prepare two spells in one slot, giving you the freedom to choose the spell when you cast it.

Name: Staff Sweep
Source: Pathfinder #151
Benefits: You sweep your foes away with your staff.

Name: Startling Appearance (Vigilante)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can startle foes who are unaware of your presence.

Name: Steady Spellcasting
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Traits: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Oracle, Sorcerer, Witch, Wizard
Benefits: You don’t lose spells easily.

Name: Stella's Stab and Snag
Benefits: You dart towards your opponent, seeking to stab them and slice their purse-strings with a single movement.

Name: Sticky Poison
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: A combination of additional viscosity and careful application keeps your weapons poisoned even when suffering significant wear and tear.

Name: Stone Blood
Benefits: Your blood clots quickly.

Name: Storm Retribution
Prerequisites: storm order; tempest surge order spell
Benefits: You lash out, directing a burst of storming fury toward a creature that has harmed you.

Name: Stumbling Feint
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You lash out confusingly with what seems to be a weak move but instead allows you to unleash a dangerous flurry of blows upon your unsuspecting foe.

Name: Sun's Fury
Benefits: The Old Sun Gods have granted you a gift in your fight against Walkena.

Name: Surprise Strike
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your sudden use of improvised weapons can take opponents off guard.

Name: Swashbuckler's Riposte
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned to riposte against ill-conceived attacks.

Name: Swift Tracker
Benefits: Your keen eyes catch signs of passage even when you’re moving.

Name: Swordmaster Dedication
Prerequisites: member of the Pathfinder Society affiliated with the School of Swords; Strength 14, Constitution 14, or Dexterity 14
Benefits: Your Swords training taught you to never lose hold of your weapon.

Name: Syu Tak-Nwa's Deadly Hair
Source: Pathfinder #166
Benefits: Your hair deals increased damage and can grapple.
